page.title: 19Religion
page.content: Most of the people living in the village of Great Doddington don't go to church. There is a Church of England building and a United Reformed Chapel. There is a resident vicar but the clergy serving the chapel are shared with Wellingborough. There is a Sunday School connected with the church which meets in the Village Hall and one that meets in a side room of the chapel. The church has its own choir and is served by a council of local people. Each year both institutions hold fund-raising activities to raise money for the upkeep of their premises. A Harvest Festval is held by each in the beginning of October of each year. Funeral services are held at both buildings and some people are still interred in the village cemetery.
